metadata.synopsis: Dialog in which you choose what you want to do with the Netherbrain after using Karsus' compulsion on it.Starts in Mental Arena, ends in sky above Baldur's Gate

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: Subdued. At last. This is its death rattle.

140.speaker: Karlach
140.text: This is it, soldier. This is what we fought for.

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *The brain is on the cusp of its final thought. And it's taking all of Karlach's strength to keep it there. An opportunity, perhaps?*

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *You glimpse the life-long destiny promised by your Father. Enslave. Dominate. Ruin.*

103.speaker: Narrator
103.text: *In your Father's name, you must seize your rightful claim to the brain, not destroy it.*

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *If you do not, then he will flay and shred your mind, so it cannot even comprehend the horrors he will plague you with.*

12.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
12.text: This is the moment, my love. The moment in which we make a new world for ourselves.

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: It can be ours, my love. The whole world - we only have to take it.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: I know what you're thinking. So let's do it. Let's seize the whole damn world and be reviled together.

94.speaker: Astarion
94.text: We could do it, you know. We could rule the world.

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *You glimpse a future where you lose all the gifts the parasite gave you - a future where you no longer see the sun.*

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Defy your Father. Command the brain to destroy the tadpoles and then itself.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Defy your Father. Tell the Emperor to command the brain to die.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Defy your Father. Tell Karlach to command the brain to destroy itself.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Claim the Absolute in the name of Bhaal.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Claim the Absolute in the name of Bhaal. Kill the Emperor.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Claim the Absolute in the name of Bhaal. Kill Orpheus.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Claim the Absolute in the name of Bhaal. Betray Karlach.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: Implore the Emperor to dominate the brain and rule the world, with you by his side.

61.speaker: The Emperor
61.text: I admire the ambition. The thought did cross my mind.

143.speaker: The Emperor
143.text: But whoever becomes the Absolute faces a war with the entire githyanki army.

16.speaker: The Emperor
16.text: Strong as we are, they are legion. I cannot be sure of survival.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: You're right - just kill the brain.

122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor gives player a nod, and turns towards the brain.

85.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: If possible, the brain closes its eyes as these lines are spoken. The mind arena begins to dim, and the face eventually fades into the darkness. Then a flash of bright light as players transition back into the real world, atop the brain, in the CombatOver dialogue.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: We can do it. I believe in us.

9.speaker: The Emperor
9.text: You have grown much. I'm proud of you.

51.speaker: The Emperor
51.text: Your faith in our bond is touching. But we did not come this far only to lose the fight for our survival at the final hurdle.

31.speaker: The Emperor
31.text: The brain will die. We will have our freedom.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: We've already killed their Prince - may as well finish what we started.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: We destroyed an entire githyanki crèche didn't we?

134.speaker: The Emperor
134.context: NodeContext: He ponders for a moment, before speaking, and when he speaks, it's decisive

29.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor and player mind flayer hover toward the brain together.

35.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player gestures and a burst of absolute energy from the ground of the mental arena, the vfx wipe the screen and reveal the player has returned to the top of the Netherbrain above the city of Baldur's Gate.

Behind the player a throne of brain matter emerges from the Netherbrain and the player seats themself upon it.

77.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Dragons and Nautiloids still fight around the the skies of Baldur's Gate.

The player closes their eyes focusing.

Arcs of electricity sprout from the base of the throne across the massive zepplin-like form of the Netherbrain. Energy is built up, until a shockwave is released.

As the dragons are caught in blast, they fall from the sky to the streets below, breathing their last licks of remaining fire.

173.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cut to the Emperor seated on a throne atop the brain, with full-illithid versions of the avatar and half-illithid versions of surviving companions standing on either side of them, chanting 'FOR THE ABSOLUTE' in the voice of the brain itself.

All are enthralled to the Emperor.

11.speaker: The Emperor
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the Emperor's face. They smile. Close up on the player standing just behind them, a mind flayer, and a thrall of the Emperor.

135.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
135.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor and player mind flayer hover toward the brain together.

95.speaker: The Emperor
95.text: Your commitment to completion is endearing. But you risk too much. We did not come this far only to lose the fight for our survival at the final hurdle.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Go ahead. Command the brain to destroy all tadpoles and then itself.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Command the brain to destroy the tadpoles and then itself.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Go ahead, Karlach. This moment's yours.

128.speaker: Karlach
128.text: No more tadpoles, brain. It's time to die.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Dominate the brain. Become the Absolute. Conquer the world.

162.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Emperor with a smirk, and slaughters him. Player picks up Netherstones from Emperor's dead body. 

Should be psionic,

161.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Orpheus with a smirk, and slaughters him. Player picks up Netherstones from Orpheus' dead body. 

Should be a psionic attack.

145.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Karlach mind flayer with a smirk, and slaughters her. Player picks up Netherstones from her dead body. 

Should be a psionic attack.

178.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Emperor with a smirk, and slaughters him. Player picks up Netherstones from Emperor's dead body. 

Should be psionic,

156.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Orpheus with a smirk, and slaughters him. Player picks up Netherstones from Orpheus' dead body. 

Should be a psionic attack.

47.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Karlach mind flayer with a smirk, and slaughters her. Player picks up Netherstones from her dead body. 

Should be a psionic attack.

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: Shka'keth! What do you think you're doing?
45.context: NodeContext: Panicking. Shkaketh = You asshole! = SHKA-keth. Kshar'lak = Traitor = h-SHAR-lahk.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: What I was born to do.

106.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
106.text: You are glorious, my love. You have never been more beautiful.

33.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player as mind flayer hovers towards the brain.

166.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Apart from Minthara, who stands closer to the player, the companions look on horrified. The black fog of the mindmelds and absolutes scenes flow from the player.

The companions struggle to stand in the presence of the New Absolute. Their squints turn into blinks, which reveal their eyes have changed to glow mind flayer orange. Their movements calm, as the black fog dissipates.

The player makes a fist and off screen we hear the sounds of the companions transforming into illithids off-screen. Minthara is spared,

60.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Apart from Minthara, who stands closer to the player, the companions look on horrified. The black fog of the mindmelds and absolutes scenes flow from the player.

The companions struggle to stand in the presence of the New Absolute. Their squints turn into blinks, which reveal their eyes have changed to glow mind flayer orange. Their movements calm, as the black fog dissipates.

The player makes a fist and off screen we hear the sounds of the companions transforming into illithids off-screen. Astarion is spared.

142.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player's companions look on horrified. The black fog of the mindmelds and absolutes scenes flow from the player.

The companions struggle to stand in the presence of the New Absolute. Their squints turn into blinks, which reveal their eyes have changed to glow mind flayer orange. Their movements calm, as the black fog dissipates.

The player makes a fist and off screen we hear the sounds of the companions transforming into illithids off-screen.

57.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player's companions look on horrified. The black fog of the mindmelds and absolutes scenes flow from the player.

The companions struggle to stand in the presence of the New Absolute. Their squints turn into blinks, which reveal their eyes have changed to glow mind flayer orange. Their movements calm, as the black fog dissipates.

The player makes a fist and off screen we hear the sounds of the companions transforming into illithids off-screen.

71.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player gestures and a burst of absolute energy from the ground of the mental arena, the vfx wipe the screen and reveal the player has returned to the top of the Netherbrain above the city of Baldur's Gate.

Behind the player a throne of brain matter emerges from the Netherbrain and the player seats themself upon it.

168.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Dragons and Nautiloids still fight around the the skies of Baldur's Gate.

The player closes their eyes focusing.

Arcs of electricity sprout from the base of the throne across the massive zepplin-like form of the Netherbrain. Energy is built up, until a shockwave is released.

As the dragons are caught in blast, they fall from the sky to the streets below, breathing their last licks of remaining fire.

180.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cut to the avatar seated on a throne atop the brain, with half-illithid versions of their surviving companions standing on either side of them, chanting 'FOR THE ABSOLUTE' in the voice of the brain itself.

They are companions no more, merely the thralls closest to the player.

83.speaker: Player
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the avatar's face (the one who made the final decision). They smile.NodeContext: With a smile - you're a god now

41.speaker: Player
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the avatar's face (the one who made the final decision). They smile.NodeContext: With a smile - you're a god now

43.speaker: Player
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the avatar's face (the one who made the final decision). They smile.NodeContext: With a smile - you're a god now

91.speaker: Player
91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the avatar's face (the one who made the final decision). They smile.NodeContext: With a smile - you're a god now

132.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player as mind flayer hovers towards the brain.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I'm doing what I planned to do from the beginning - taking control.

38.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor and player mind flayer hover toward the brain together.

30.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor and player mind flayer hover toward the brain together.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I'm doing what I planned to do from the beginning - taking control.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Don't worry - you're still part of my design.

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: Stop - STOP! What are you doing?!

4.speaker: Jaheira
4.text: Malar's mark, what are you DOING?
4.context: NodeContext: mal-AHR - swear word, incredulous anger / fear - player is betraying us at the end.

6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
6.context: InternalNodeContext: This inclusion only if Astarion did not previously encourage the player to choose an evil ending.

69.speaker: Wyll
69.text: No no no. By the Nine Circles, what are you doing?

127.speaker: Astarion
127.text: What in all the sweet hells are you doing?!
127.context: InternalNodeContext: This inclusion only if Astarion did not previously encourage the player to choose an evil ending.

163.speaker: Minsc
163.text: NO! We will NOT let this come to pass!

164.speaker: Halsin
164.text: No! Cease now, before you doom us all!

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Betray Karlach. Dominate the brain. Become the Absolute.

154.speaker: Karlach
154.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player advances towards Karlach threateningly.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Betray the Emperor. Dominate the brain. Become the Absolute.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Betray Orpheus. Dominate the brain. Become the Absolute.

165.speaker: Narrator
165.text: *Your Father's expectation feels like a noose around your neck. Now is the moment to dominate the world in his name.*

18.speaker: Orpheus
18.text: There. At last. It is subdued.

124.speaker: Orpheus
124.text: And thus I honour my mother's legacy. The Grand Design, once again, ended by my line.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *The brain is on the cusp of its final thought. And it's taking all of Orpheus' strength to keep it there. An opportunity perhaps?*

136.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player has beaten the the smaller smackable brain (the brain without a face) away, and we're left face to face with the big brain with a ginormous face, which is ready to plead for its life.

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: Silence, brain! The Grand Design has failed. You have failed!
73.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the netherbrain

14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
14.text: It is afraid - good. Show no mercy.
14.context: NodeContext: sadistic pleasure mixed with relief - this is the end, and the final enemy (the netherbrain) has surrendered

7.speaker: Jaheira
7.text: The bleating of a predator turned suddenly prey. Do not listen.
7.context: NodeContext: Firm, mercliess as the Brain begs us to spare it

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: Command it to die. End this.

62.speaker: Karlach
62.text: This is it. You have to command it to die!

5.speaker: Jaheira
5.text: There is only one order to give. 'Die'.
5.context: NodeContext: firm and merciless as the brain makes us promises.

46.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
46.text: We are giving the orders now - command it to obey! Seize control!
46.context: NodeContext: sadistic and triumphant - the final enemy has surrendered, and her vegeance has come at last

107.speaker: Wyll
107.text: You know what to do. Kill the godsdamned thing.

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.text: Order it to die! Do it now, before it's too late!

153.speaker: Astarion
153.text: All right, it's time. Let's end this.
153.context: NodeContext: a little sad, he's about to give up the ability to walk in the sun

170.speaker: Minsc
170.text: Tell it to split its own seams - end this!
170.context: NodeContext: Sharp, merciless - telling us to order the netherbrain to destroy itself

181.speaker: Halsin
181.text: Command it to die! It must be now!
181.context: NodeContext: Urgent cry during climactic battle

104.speaker: Wyll
104.text: Shut it out. Let it die.

111.speaker: Shadowheart
111.text: Don't listen! It'll try any trick in order to survive!

125.speaker: Gale
125.text: Ignore it. Nothing but a vile death rattle.

150.speaker: Astarion
150.text: Shut it out. It's on the precipice - push it over.

167.speaker: Minsc
167.text: No! NO more listening to brains!
167.context: NodeContext: Sharp, not having any of it

174.speaker: Halsin
174.text: The end is upon us - ignore the brain's pleas. It must die!
174.context: NodeContext: Urgent cry during climactic battle

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: It knows this is the end of the road. Pay it no mind.

175.speaker: Orpheus
175.text: There. At last. It is subdued.

114.speaker: The Emperor
114.text: Subdued at last - it begs for its life.

148.speaker: The Emperor
148.text: Subdued at last - it begs for its life.

115.speaker: The Emperor
115.text: It pleads because it knows I am its master. I will finish this.

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *The brain is on the cusp of its final thought. And it's taking all of the Emperor's strength to keep it there. An opportunity perhaps?*
